Key Match Events: Joey Ortiz drove in three runs for Milwaukee with a bases-loaded single in the fourth inning.
Milwaukee scored four runs in the eighth inning off Reed Garrett.
Quintana and four relievers combined to strike out 18, their most in a nine-inning game since September 2022.
The Brewers won despite striking out at least 18 times in a nine-inning game for the third time.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets lost their third straight game and fell one game behind Atlanta in the NL wild card race.
The Braves' win over Kansas City and Arizona's loss helped the Mets and Braves maintain their playoff chances.
Carlos Mendoza stated that the Mets need to capitalize on opportunities in their remaining games.
Post-Match Reflections: Pete Alonso expressed that the Mets need to capitalize on opportunities in their remaining games.
Carlos Mendoza acknowledged the difficult situation and emphasized the need to win the next game and see where they stand.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets were shut out for the first time since August 23 and were held to two hits or fewer for just the fifth time this year.
